intro: Hieracium subbarbatum, commonly known as the subbarbate hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–50 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, blooming from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium subbarbatum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
